intro: Dissocarpus biflorus var. villosus, commonly known as the hairy two-flowered dissocarpus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "villosus." Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens. This species is often found in dry, open habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
